pages.text: Megamastax amblyodus (which translates to "blunt-toothed big mouth") was a species of lobe-finned fish that lived during the Late Silurian (around 423 million years ago). Its remains (which are rather fragmentary, consisting only of a semi-complete lower jaw) have been found in the Kuanti Formation in China. It is currently the largest known vertebrate of its time period, estimated at a whopping 1 metre long.

Rounded coronoid teeth suggest that this early vertebrate apex predator fed mainly on hard-shelled prey which, between the various molluscs, trilobites, brachiopods, jawless fish and early placoderms, existed in abundance.$(br)$(br)$(br)$(l)Eats:$() Fish$(br)$(l)Breeds with:$() Fish$(br)$(l)Egg Type:$() Drops Egg$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Bucket
